attributes.action: Make it fair for the higher  tax payers no gain means no gain, not we have to pay £360 in extra tax for it.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Mr Darling in his wisdom is giving everyone a £600 rise on their tax allownaces, how nice of him :-). For the low income this will mean they will pay £120 less :-), for the higher tax payer this would mean  they too would pay £120 less.

But Mr Darling is reducing the higher tax payers threshold by £1,200 (sourced from inland revenue) to balance the books so there is no gain of the £120 for us.

Aaah but, Mr Darling by reducing the rate at £1,200 is going to take off you the tidy sum of £480 more per year in tax, less the £120 that you cannot gain.  This means for all you 40p in the pound tax payers YOU WILL BE PAYING £360 more in tax for not gaining £120.

The reduction to cancel out the £120 gain should only be £300 reduction of the threshold.  

It doesn't take a genius to know that we are being ripped of here. 

Say no to the £1,200 reduction and yes to £300. So all is fair.

Send this on and register your vote.
